questions.question: Is the beige sofa present with its original cushion arrangement?
questions.explanation: In Image B, the beige sofa is visible with three cushions, two in a lighter shade and one darker. This arrangement matches the arrangement seen in Image A, indicating no change. Comparing both images confirms that the sofa's cushion arrangement remains the same in Image B.

questions.question: Does the painting above the sofa retain its mountain silhouettes and tree outlines?
questions.explanation: Image B shows the painting above the sofa, featuring mountains and trees. The design elements such as mountain silhouettes and tree outlines are distinct and similar to those in Image A. The comparison shows that the painting retains these aspects.

questions.question: Is the potted plant with long green leaves present to the right of the sofa?
questions.explanation: In Image B, a potted plant with elongated green leaves is placed to the right of the sofa. It visually corresponds with the one present in Image A, in the same location and style, confirming its presence in Image B.

questions.question: Is the woven rug still positioned under the sofa?
questions.explanation: Image B displays the area under the sofa with a visible woven rug, its texture and placement suggest consistency with the rug seen in Image A. The comparison indicates this element is unchanged in Image B.

questions.question: Is the wood-paneled section of the wall visible next to the potted plant?
questions.explanation: In Image B, next to the potted plant, there is a section of wall featuring vertical wood panels. This detail corresponds with what is observed in Image A, showing the wood-paneled section is visible and unchanged in Image B.
